intro: Microcephala lamellata subsp. lamellata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed microcephala, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in cool, temperate climates with well-drained soils. The plant is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it exhibits adaptations to harsh weather conditions. Its botanical structure includes a taproot system and hairy stems, which help in water retention and protection against herbivores.
